/* Cast and characters */ Not bumbling. Just accent-wise. The bit where he says "That is what I said, 'Pecker'" is just like Clouseau saying "That is what I said, 'reum' (room)".
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 172480173 by [[Special:Contributions/Jienum|Jienum]] ([[User talk:Jienum|talk]]) personal comparison, not at all bumbling
/* Critical reaction */ If you insist on ruining Ebert's quote, it's better to recast the sentence, as I have done here.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 172469537 by [[Special:Contributions/Bignole|Bignole]] ([[User talk:Bignole|talk]]) Roger Ebert agrees with me, and he's a better writer than you
two people disagree with you my friend
In fact, the poor grammar actually "works" with the repeated "too many"s, by maintaining the rhythm of the list. But it jumps out at the reader in the edited version.
Actually, the poor grammar (no "and") was in the original. But the repeated "too many"s are part of the feel of the quote, and should be kept.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 172458785 by [[Special:Contributions/Alientraveller|Alientraveller]] ([[User talk:Alientraveller|talk]]) The elipses ruin the quote's flow AND make it gramatically wrong
it may be a quote, but it doesn't have to be word for word
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 172420343 by [[Special:Contributions/Bignole|Bignole]] ([[User talk:Bignole|talk]]) For God's sake, it's a quotation. He is using repetition to make a point.
/* Critical reaction */ don't need all the "too many"s
/* Critical reaction */ it's only run-on when there isn't punctuation, no one else gets two separate sentences, semi-colons shows a close relationship between the two statements
/* Critical reaction */ Removed redundant "Ebert thought" because the direct quotations makes clear it's Ebert's view.
Split up run-on sentence. Dude, periods are your friend.
/* Critical reaction */ trim some unnecessary bits
no one else gets that much text, who put a scroll box here
Two long, long sentences like that are better separated with a period than jammed together with a semicolon. It reads better.
Changed comments re Ebert's review to be consistently past tense; before, some were past tense ("thought") and some were present tense ("believes")
/* Critical reaction */ how many stars it got is redundant, you already use the word "praise", don't need multiple sentences
/* Critical reaction */ Clean-up. Ebert's comment about Sandman being of "marginal interest" referred to his role in the story as the murderer of Uncle Ben -- not to Church's portrayal of him
/* Critical reaction */ Added description of Roger Ebert's belated review
there is no Mysterio figure, and none cited
